meanings.definition: To make something seem old-fashioned or outdated.
meanings.sent1: She archaises her wardrobe by wearing vintage dresses.
meanings.sent2: The movie archaises the setting by using retro props.
meanings.sent3: The play archaises the costumes for a comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: His speech archaises the audience back to a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The antique shop archaises the shop window with old artifacts.

meanings.definition: To use outdated language or style.
meanings.sent1: The author archaises his writing with formal phrases.
meanings.sent2: Her speech archaises expressions from the past.
meanings.sent3: The teacher archaises slang terms to teach a lesson.
meanings.sent4: His jokes archaises the humor of a different time.
meanings.sent5: The magazine archaises its headlines to attract older readers.

meanings.definition: To cause something to become obsolete or out of date.
meanings.sent2: The company archaises its products by not updating them.
meanings.sent3: His actions archaises his reputation in the industry.
meanings.sent4: The trend archaises traditional customs in society.
meanings.sent5: The fast-paced world archaises slow processes over time.
